Reviews.Title: “basic but good value”
Reviews.Author: soulsister331
Reviews.Content: booked a studio apartment for 3 nights but was given a suite (bedroom/kitchen/bathroom/sitting room. Got a last minute deal on the net so paid £45 per night. Rooms were large and reasonably clean apart from a small child's chocolate handprint on the bathroom door! TV in the sitting room was fine but bedroom tv didn't work until my son pulled the unit out and it wasn't even plugged in.Housekeeping staff didn't turn up until the afternoon which isn't much good if you intend to escape the heat for a while. Didn't use the cafe or restaurant but did use room service which was quite slow (45 mins) but well priced and good selection. The airport shuttle costs dhs40, about dhs5 cheaper than a taxi. Staff were courteous and polite and its a good base if you don't plan to spend too much time in the hotel itself. Wi-Fi was only available in the reception area. Probably wouldn't return to this particular hotel as there are lots of alternatives but it was fine for the 3 days I was there.

Reviews.Title: “worth the stay...would stay again”
Reviews.Author: NHM
Reviews.Content: stayed at the winchester grand apartements in bur dubai. spacious lounge, kitchen and good sized bedroom, flat screen tv in lounge and bedroom, various channel including sky news and bbc, lots of bollywood channels. hotel clean, service good. gym, sauna and average price swimming pool. Mina bazaar about 15 minutes walk from hotel. breakfast was not included but we could have had it for about £5 per day, didn't use the restaurant so cant comment on that. All in all, for the price paid, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Would return-definitely”
Reviews.Author: mmoly
Reviews.Content: Accommodating staff, good sized room with microwave, 2 burner cooktop, refrig, and equipment. Automatic washer. No dryer; however, if you bag the clothes, the hotel will have them dried for you at no charge. Arrived and found a king size bed when we wanted a twin. No problem, said the hotel, and within ten minutes, the room had been transformed by very pleasant workers. Pool and hot tub were comfortable. Sauna and steam room for women separate from the men's so it is available at all times when the pool is open (7-10). Restaurant buffet (did not try). Near other hotels where you can have a drink w/lunch/dinner. 3 blocks or so to good shopping and restaurants----try an outdoor corner south Indian restaurant---superb! Spinney's is nearby where you can't go wrong with European, Chinese, Indian grocery items--many prepared in deli, bakery style.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: silverborg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a recent family holiday and I thought the hotel offered very good value for money. The hotel rooms are clean and very spacious - our bedroom had a balcony and there was a separate lounge and dining area, as well as kitchenette. Although it's not within walking distance of the beach or the city centre, the hotel offers a free shuttle service to several key attractions and taxis in Dubai are cheap anyway. There is also a swimming pool on the roof, which was clean and pleasent. Note that this hotel isn't licensed, but there are a couple other hotels within about 200m where you can go for a drink if you so desire. This isn't a luxury hotel but if you just want somewhere cheap and basic to sleep while you explore Dubai then it's a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel providing a budget experience - generally bad for Dubai”
Reviews.Author: ogajim
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights here in an Executive 1 bed Suite as most of our usual hotels in Dubai were booked due to various busy events.Taxi from the airport didn't know the place as was often the case with others we subsequently used.The hotel is located away from the main roads closely in amongst other medium to high rise in Bur Dubai. Reception was cheerful and welcoming as were all of the front of house staff - but believe me that was the sum of it. Our room had a peculiar odour but was clean (and was kept immaculately clean). The room-safe was not working and despite many calls to reception and to the maintenance staff it was not fixed despite promises that it would be seen to 'right away' - nobody came. The shower was an absolute joke with hardly any proper operating pressure. Requests for this to be remedied met with the same response as with the room-safe. The satellite old-fasioned TVs had a poor selection of channels which generally were not properly tuned in.Requests for this to be remedied - yes,you've got it - were treated in exactly the same way as the room-safe and the shower. Breakfast was an experience we would not wish to have to endure again - filthy uncleared tables, juices dispensed from a machine into paper cups, dirty cutlery and appallingly indifferent service. The fruit selection was adequate but at all times we were concerned at the hygiene in it's preparation and of the state of the kitchen given the deplorable couldn't care less attitude of the staff. Coffee (instant) served from a jug had globules of something floating on the surface. We did not eat there again and chose to go elsewhere for our meals. All in all this was a let-down from the otherwise generally excellent establishments previously experienced over a number of years in Dubai - this hotel does not deserve it's classification - a thoroughly unhappy experience.

Reviews.Title: “ok accommodation”
Reviews.Author: moss b
Reviews.Content: a good standard place to stay not luxurious but does the basics well, you can expect a clean tidy room, nice clean bathroom and clean tidy lobby etc. the staff are polite and helpful even late at night (we had a problem early hours of the morning and maintenance was sent up within 10 mins) the roof top pool was clean and tidy although i did not swim in it as i was on a 36 hour stop over. Location wise not bad all the taxi driver know where it is and taxi's are cheap in dubai so not a big problem to travel out from the local area to the centre or beach and if your on a budget the hotel offer a shuttle bus at regular times throughout the day. i would stay again for a quick visit but if your looking for more than a day or 2 or somewhere for a couples stay i would choose something more upmarket.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Humble...”
Reviews.Author: Pernille F
Reviews.Content: Nice place. We really did enjoy our stay. The staff was friendly and helpfull. Would Recommend it... Very clean and quick to help you with problems. And nice with free shuttle around Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: YCh1
Reviews.Content: Unheard of property, but was pleasantly surprised with the good facilities, clean rooms and friendly service. Though a bit inside surrounded by residential apartments, but hotel staff was very helpful in calling taxi's which are available abundantly at short notice. Nice restaurant though not much of a variety/options.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel of average quality and good location”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently 2 nights for a short leisure trip to Dubai. I was under the impression that this is a 4-star hotel, but feel that it is more of a 2.5 to 3-star facility. The hotel is quite conveniently located in central Dubai. It is a short 15-20 minutes cab ride from the airport and about 10-15 minutes walk from a subway station. There is a 24-hour grocery store on the way to the subway and made it easy to pick up water and snacks. Wireless internet is provided for free in the lobby only and wired internet for a fee (extra for the cord) in the room. The cleanliness of the room was acceptable, but the quality of the room was sub-par. There are a number of places that show unacceptable wear and tear. Quality of the service was somewhat inconsistent. I arrived early and was told I could pay extra to check in early. When I said I would come back later, the front desk changed his mind and said they can have a room ready without charging me extra. There was a problem with my safety deposit box, and although I told the front desk about it before I left for the day, it was not taken care of until I called again the next day. The first hour I was in the room, about 3 staff members knocked on my door to ask if everything was OK. I mentioned to them too the safety deposit box issue and they said it would be taken care of. I interacted with the front desk staff a couple of times. Some staff members were friendly and helpful. A couple others seemed too busy/distracted to give me their full attention. I had no problems with the bed, sleeping comfortably or the noise level. They do provide free shuttle service to both airport and a number of popular tourist destinations. I called ahead to have them pick me up at the airport but was told the shuttle wasn't running at that hour (mid morning). If you are looking for a basic hotel with fairly standard and bare-bone services, this is a pretty good bargain.

Reviews.Title: “big room, fantastic buffet”
Reviews.Author: wendy h
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the excellent value restaurant here - under 30 dhs for an all you can eat buffet - great selection and great service. Pool area was nice - good jacuzzi and lit up for evening swims. Smoking around pool not so nice for little ones.. Great wonderful shuttle bus service - faultless and so helpful. Overall service good. Bed extremely comfortable Room a bit shabby - little things-- tile missing, scruffy marks, rusty washing maching, kettle lid didn't close, no washing up liquid or cloths, only one of each toiletry, towels old. Good but not outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ramsey408
Reviews.Content: Stayed at winchester grand deluxe hotel, very pleased with location, great food, lovely staff, very useful free shuttle bus to beach, shopping mall and metro. biggest room we have ever stayed in, everything you need from ironing board to teaspoon! will defiantly use this hotel again in the future, reccomended for familys, single persons, couples young and old.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant hotel for a brief visit to Dubai”
Reviews.Author: PaulandJenn
Reviews.Content: We stopped over in Dubai for one night, and found the Wincheter to be a convenient base from which to explore the city. We arrived at dawn, which was 45 minutes before our room was ready, but the hotel staff helpfully suggested that we visit the rooftop pool. This was a great suggestion for weary travellers like us. The room was large and tidy, and the service was courteous and helpful. We enjoyed our stay!! The hotel was within a reasonable distance from the Dubai Museum (well worthwhile)' and the canal area. Reasonable distance, but a little on the warm side to walk (trust us on this one).

Reviews.Title: “Nice place if you are on buiness trip”
Reviews.Author: bramhabull
Reviews.Content: Simply the best and well located. Loved the location, service and main thing is the food. breakfast and dinner was great. Other indian restaraunts are closeby and at easy walkable distance There are bars also nearby. It is just another home When you visit Dubai don't forget to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sfcghh
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel and the staff are really nice!!! Savio the assistant manager was very helpfull and the WIFI in the lobby was good and the staff always kept you company... Room are so nice nd spacey

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: ggordon5
Reviews.Content: The shuttle service at this hotel was excellent. There is a pool on the roof and it has a nice view of Burj Khalifa and the city.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and good hotel with good location in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Tuhkimo
Reviews.Content: We were absolutely surprised and impressed by the Winchester Grand Hotel in Dubai. We booked our stay via hotels.com for 40€/night and enjoyed our 7 nights at the hotel a lot. The rooftop swimming pool and jacuzzi were very nice and clean (we usually went there in the evening before it closed at 10pm), the rooms (we had the cheapest) were spacious with tv and balcony and they were cleaned every day (new towels and new shower gel, shampoo, etc.). The staff was extremely friendly, even though depending on who was sitting at the reception, they couldn´t help us much (e.g. we asked about the camel racing court). The location is good, too. Close to the airport, close to a mall (Burjuman) and Al Karama and Meena Basaar are in walking distance. However, if you wanna go to Deira, the beach or to downtown Dubai you gotta take a cab which are really cheap, especially if you´re not travelling alone (taxi from the airport to the hotel is about 20-30DHS which is like 5€). Even we as students could afford it and never used the nearby metro a single time. Furthermore, the hotel offers shuttle services (e.g. to Dubai Mall, the beach, Deira) for free which is always on time and reliable. The only thing, I found a bit disturbing was that the walls are quite thin. We were on 7th floor and we could hear the street noise or the baby in the next room crying at night. The food is very good and cheap, but spicy (about 5€ for lunch or dinner buffet). We could leave our luggage until 2am in the night, since we had to be at the airport at 3am and we did not have to pay extra. If I ever go back to Dubai, I would always return to the Winchester. We had an amazing time in Dubai and the hotel! Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable and relaxing place to crash”
Reviews.Author: clinth
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel from a Last Minute deal and was not disappointed at all. We stayed here for 7 nights. They do offer an airport pick up service which you can email them about from their website, however we chose to go by taxi. I would probably recommend using the hotel service as it would ahve worked out cheaper! What I want from a hotel is what most people want, a quiet comfortable place to crash after sighhtseeing and enjoying the city all day. This hotel did everything it said it would with no fuss, no frills and no problem. We had an apartment on the 6th floor that had a bedroom, a separate kitchen, a separate bathroom and another living room with 2 sofas - one which was a fold out. There was a TV in the bedroom and the living room. The bed was king sized and very comfortable. The sofa bed was also very comfortable and double sized. Every day the bed and sofa bed was changed by house keeping along with all towels. The air conditioning was very good but be warned it can be freezing if you don't turn it off! We didn't have any sort of view but this wasn't really a problem at all. The pool on the roof was very warm, with a hot jacuzzi at the far end. You could use towels provided up there for you. There were also sun beds there which I didn't use as I only had a swim every evening after a long day out in the sun. It was always empty apart from one evening but this wasn't a problem either as there was plenty of room for all. We had breakfast included and I knew from other reviews that this wasn't going to be what many westerners would expect and so I wasn't disappointed at all. The hotel catered for Indian guests as well as made a good attempt to make western guests satisfied. There was toast and croissants as well as potatoes (in different forms each day - hash browns, mashed or fried with onions) baked beans, sausages, mushrooms and sometimes chicken livers! (yum). They had Indian options which were also very good, along with juices and tea/coffee. Newspapers and TV News were also available to make your breakfast as relaxing as possible. The location is about a 20m walk to Al Karama or Khalid Bin Al Waleed Metro stations as well as Spinneys supermarket, ATM machines, McDonalds, Money Exchange etc... or a very cheap taxi to anywhere else in the city. Be warned that just around the corner there is also another Winchester Hotel as well, owned by the same people I believe - so ensure taxi drivers are aware that this one is on 10B Street around the corner from the other one! Overall I was happy. This would be considered a 3 star hotel with good customer service, FREE WIFI in the lobby, a decent breakfast, a decent pool and a comfortable good size apartment room. All three of us were very satisfied by this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice overnight stay!”
Reviews.Author: PomPerth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed overnight on the 24th September, and were very pleased with our stay, If you are expecting fancy fittings then go elsewhere, and pay extra! We were thrilled at the size of the room, and everything was very clean, and we were pleased at the facilities that the room provided. (kettle, cups, plates, microwave, washer etc). The staff were great and very helpful. They always had a smile on their faces and were always willing to answer our questions. We would not hesitate in staying there again. Just to inform you though that the breakfast was a little bit different than a European one, but when in Rome! And lets face it, you are there to experience the culture and beautiful place of Dubai! Taxis from Winchester are easy to get, and as others have mentioned, they are very cheap, and airconditioned! We would definately stay there again! Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “winchester good staff, nice pool but scruffy room.”
Reviews.Author: Jannerman
Reviews.Content: For a short business trip it was acceptable but for leisure I would not reccomend this venue. The airport pick up was late and for 60 [local] you could just have easily got a taxi and avoided waiting in the heat. Airpot ride back was suddenly not avaialble when i check out so they 40 [local] off me and sent me in a taxi which the meter sad cost 22 [local] Staff very friendly and helpful. Room a bit scruffy and in need of some warmth, by that I mean decor/pictures.charachter and also the paint freshening up. There was no view at all other than neighbouring air con units. The buffet lunch and dinner seems good value at 29 [local] but it it is generally different shades of curry and rice combinations and sits there for three hours undisturbed,just keeping warm. Much better value at other nearby hotels where for a bit more the buffet was fantastic and included beer & wines. My wake up call did not happen but luckily my alarm woke me up. The receptionist told me she sent the porter to wake me but he denied this, anyways I got to the airport on time but if I HAD RELIED ON THEM I might still be there! The pluses: The roof top pool area is clean and well looked after, as was the gym area. No lifeguard if you have kids but area regularly checked for cleanliness. Overall staff very friendly and helpful but hotel not situated for anthing other than a short business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience, would NOT recommend”
Reviews.Author: Benny_Doda
Reviews.Content: The hotel was of very average standard and my non-smoking room was as fresh as a recently used ashtray. The hotel shuttle dropped me at the Dubai mall and didnt return leaving me waiting for 90 mins. The hotel could not change a 500 D note for the taxi I had to catch home as a result. The next day having learned my lesson I tried to change a 100 D note which they also couldnt change despite having a restaurant and a float and we are talking $25US. The internet only works in the lobby which is very inconvenient and the staff although friendly were largely clueless. I was amazed they have anyone stay here as I cant think of one redeming quality other than the location which is superb. Good luck staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , helpful & friendly staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vidya M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conviniently located to most of the attractions of Dubai. Their hotel shuttle is free to most of the attractions. The rooms very very clean and huge. I didn't expect a kitchenette and a washer. The staff was so friendly and helpful. Overall, enjoyed our stay here. Would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall the hotel was lovely.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisJohnson_20
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at the Winchester Grand Hotel for 6 nights. It was situated very close to the Meena Bazar, Burjuman Mall and the Metro station. There are two Winchester hotels : Winchester Grand (which I stayed at) and Winchester Deluxe, they are in the same company. Some of the websites show that they are 4 star, but i think that the one i stayed at is not 4 star but three. The four star is the Winchester deluxe which is a much newer building. The hotel provided a free shuttle service at allocated time which was bonus, but it is not necessary as the taxis in Dubai are very cheap; meters start from 3 dihrams and the minimum charge is 10 dirham. From Bur Dubai where the hotel was to the gold souk in deira (opposite Bur Dubai with a creek in between) costed about 13 dirham, which works out to be about £2.30 approx which is certainly very cheap. We booked two rooms: one studio bedroom and one executive bedroom. The rooms were generally kept tidy. The air condition in the studio bedroom worked properly but it wasn't working properly in executive bedroom. The shower was also not working properly and it seemed the shower head was tired and in need of replacement. The other strange thing was that when the cold tape was opened, hot water came throughout the whole day which made it slightly miserable, but I think this is normal in Dubai, as i I experienced it also in Dubai airport toilets. The swimming pool is small, but well maintained. The best time to cool yourself would be at night. I think that the pool was opening times are 11am to 10pm. The hotel staff will need to improve on their facial expressions i.e smile; which we thought lacked in the staff. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The price for 6 nights was reasonable. I booked the hotel through lastminute.com. I would advise to anyone looking for hotels in Dubai do a search of prices on different websites as they vary greatly. I also found a 10% discount code from Google, which was great. Hope my feedback helps you.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay ruined by over charging!”
Reviews.Author: Mahmood S
Reviews.Content: Good, clean and very good service ruined by hotel reception staff charging me for transfer fees from and too the airport which was included in my package. Seems like people will try anything to be dishonest and try to over charge clients on this side of the world, which was disappointing and a bad start to my holiday. The hotel should have done more to sort this out rather than having to sort this out myself on my return to the UK from the travel agent I booked the package. For these reasons I will be highly unlikely to book again to stay at this hotel or use the same holiday provider. It's a shame since I had a good stay and a good time in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Hafq
Reviews.Content: All hotel staff were extremely helpful. The service was great. The food was brilliant and the room was very clean. This is a quiet and relaxing hotel. Great pool area and the room serive was brill. It is also not too far from all the main sites in Dubai. Would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: Shamim112
Reviews.Content: I spent 15 nights at the Winchester Grand with my daughter and we both enjoyed it very much. The hotel is in a great location, quiet enough for a good night's sleep, but not too far from the main road. The hotel provides a shuttle bus to several landmarks eg. BurJuman Shopping Centre, Dubai Mall, Meena Bazaar to name a few, which is very handy and the driver provided a reliable and pleasant service. You are never too far from a taxi as they pass the hotel quite frequently, which was ideal as the heat and humidity was intense. The staff are all very pleasant and helpful and answer any queries you have regards getting to places and the best way to do it. I really appreciated the advice I was given. Service was always with a smile. We had a problem with our toilet and it was dealt with promptly and efficiently. We stayed on a room only basis, but did have lunch at the hotel once. There was a good selection of hot, tasty food....indian style, which was rather delicious. The roof top pool was very clean and well maintained by the attendants. They did a great job of making sure everything was ok. Towels are provided by the hotel at the pool area so there is no need to take your own towel up to the pool and there are also sun loungers and chairs to relax on. The housekeepers made a great job of keeping the room tidy. Clean sheets were placed on the beds every day and the towels were replaced daily too. The toiletries and toilet paper were kept topped up. Check-in and check was fairly swift and problem free. We asked the hotel to provide our transport to the airport and the driver was at the hotel to pick us up bang on time. The free wi-fi available in the lobby area was perfect for us. We would definitely return to the Winchester Grand if we holiday in Dubai again and absolutely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Practical and Convenient with a touch of Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Aussie893
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a 3 night stopover between Australia and Europe. Got a great deal being low tourist season, and reaped the benefits with great service from the staff and a clean and very comfortable room. The staff were willing to help with all my requests, and they made my stay hassle free. The free shuttle bus was fantastic, making trips to the major attractions and the local public transport very easy and nicely air-conditioned! I enjoyed lunch in the restaurant very much, and an evening by the poolside was more than pleasant. I recommend a desert safari, Dubai Mall, the spice and gold souks in Bur Deira and 'The Walk' at Jumeirah Beach Resdiences as must see attractions. I could not have enjoyed my time in Dubai as much without the convenience and comfort of Winchester. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Quality & Value”
Reviews.Author: Erchie01
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a week in Dubai, staying at The Winchester Grand, and were thoroughly impressed by the quality, service, facilities and value of the hotel. Our room was spacious, comfortable, quiet and very well equipped, and the roof-top pool was a decent size, with enough sunbeds and umbrellas to provide comfortable shade. The multigym was also very well stocked with modern kit. A good lcation in central Bur Dubai meant that taxi's were readily available, and the hotel's free shuttle twice a day to key tourist spots worked well. If we return to Dubai, there'll be only one place we'll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Miss you already! :)”
Reviews.Author: MadamSunburn
Reviews.Content: We just arrived back home from Dubai. This hotel is in good location and the shuttle service is excellent!!! You don't need a taxi to see Dubai, this service makes it possible for you. Hotel staff is extremely friendly and helpful. It's nice, that you can book day trips from reception and it's so great that they will arrange everything for you! Hotel staff in gym and pool area were so nice!!! ;) They were always happy and there for you! It was safe to walk nearby the hotel, even if you are walking without men. Hotelroom was always very clean and we slept very well. We didn't hear almost any noises from outside. We definitely would recommend this hotel to people who want to explore Dubai and be active.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, we wil come back again”
Reviews.Author: ipe1965
Reviews.Content: Nice and good service, very good transportation to several places. Nice room, very friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: cookielicious
Reviews.Content: I do not think it was a 4* hotel more of a 3*. I found the hotel to be nosey at night and you can hear people in the other rooms. The staff were pleasant but i found the location to be not very central and it takes 15-20 mins to the nearest metro station. Overall I think it is average and would recommend it for people who dont care about location and looking for somewhere cheap to stay. If you are looking to be near the souks and more interesting area I would recommend Deira area. The area of this hotel is called al Karama and its full of Expats and thats why its cheaper compared to other areas. The room itself was clean but the bathroom had a fair deal of wear and tear, the bath had paint coming off and the vent was coming off the wall. I describe it as AVERAGE !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarsSovereign
Reviews.Content: Location is great, Hotel Staff are some of the most helpful hotel staff I have ever had the pleasure to deal with. The restaurant choice and quality was good. The swimming pool on the rooftop fantastic at 7am in the morning! The Jacuzzi, Steam Room, Sauna and Gym all excellent. The "room/apartment" was big. Plenty of space. Tea/Coffee/ Ironing Board /Kettle/ Microwave... all very handy to have. Room Service was excellent.. I really cannot find fault with this Hotel.... Except, Taxi's struggle to find it.. ASK for the Golden Sands Resort Hotels... (Theres 5 of them) so most of the taxi drivers know where you mean then!.. and finally Yes this hotel is certainly not a "proper" 4* by European standards, but definitely, 3* +.... The Shuttle Bus is a great bonus.. we used it for the beach, the Mall and the Market.. at times, just myself and my colleague on it, so like having our own private driver!!As above, the Hotel ticks all the right boxes. I will most certainly be returning here again, and Im quite a fussy traveller!! NB Management, You have an amazing bunch of staff there, including Vikas, and the young Security Guard.. and the other guys behind reception! We arrived very early last Friday morning.. but didnt have to wait too long for our room, we went swimming whilst waiting!! Our Booking was under Umaro... just 2 of us, twin, room 111.... We WILL see you again very soon, hopefully! Once again thank you for a very pleasant stay. Ryan.

Reviews.Title: “Rest and best”
Reviews.Author: golshahim
Reviews.Content: that was good and nice hotel with polite stuff.free parking and easy access to centre. and self catering and kichen every things was fine.

Reviews.Title: “A Satisfied Stay”
Reviews.Author: danielBahrain
Reviews.Content: The apartment is ideally located. Rooms are spacious and the staff are friendly. I would recommend this apartment to Business, Leisure & Family travel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room Great Service Great Location Free Shuttle!!”
Reviews.Author: PanditAnil
Reviews.Content: The room was big with full kithchenette, huge clean bathroom with shower, big bed, safe, great front desk staff who answered all my silly questions with a smile, great location near al karama indian area with excellent restaurants at low prices, they had a shuttle to various locations + taxis were cheap too + train station is 15 min walk. Will stay here again. Great value thru priceline/booking.com.

Reviews.Title: “NOT BAD AS I THOUGHT”
Reviews.Author: mash67
Reviews.Content: Nice place can do with room decor, breakfast ok and dinner roof top swimming pool good views and clean, location very good dont book tours from here look around check local papers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: upul54
Reviews.Content: We were first time in Dubai, when we searching hotel found this hotel.with reasonable rates but we don't know how is conditions , we saw only web pics . however i and my wife finally , has decided book the hotel , After arrival at the hotel, we saw it was excellent condition and nice staff , and Foods are available reasonable rates ,buffets from breakfast to dinner at hotel restaurant . the hotel located very convince places to Gold sock, Dubai Mall etc.,

Reviews.Title: “Pleasurable stay”
Reviews.Author: saf014
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a month at Winchester Grand Dubai and I had absolutely enjoyable stay, form reception, Room Service, Restaurant and all the Hotel Staff were very helpful and very hospitable with smile on the faeces all the time which exactly what I needed during my Business stay and for sure I’m coming back with my family for a holiday and will stay at the Grand. I do recommend it for both Business and Holiday. All the best and keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for our memorable holiday in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: DandLNairn_Scotland
Reviews.Content: Hotel very well situated for walking ,getting taxi, attractions and Bujaman Mall. Staff very helpful although breakfast could be hectic for staff. Evening meal very good value. pool facilities were good as were attendants, perhaps a few more sun beds, on saying that we never had to do without. Bed huge! and comfortable as was room.Any maintainance problems were dealt with immediatley.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly convenient, no constraints, warm and welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: Leander2k
Reviews.Content: Sauna/Hammam/swimming pool/jacuzzi/Sport rooms : we are completely autonomous, few people and good quality of facilities. Rooms : perfectly clean, + of a hotel, + of a location : washing machine, kitchen. The bed was perfect. Everything was working, even if the kitchen was a bit old, it was functional and it is exactly what we needed to be autonomous regarding food. The hotel is clean and the personnel is amazingly nice and welcoming. Great free delivery services in Dubai : Chili's, Burger king, Great shawarmas, pizza....

Reviews.Title: “Dumped into 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: muxloe
Reviews.Content: Arrived in the middle of the night to find the hotel full and we were put in lower grade hotel. We had confirmed our booking a week before the flight.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: traveller189937
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly, but that´s it. Whole hotel needs quick repairing.

Reviews.Title: “excellant hotel, staffs and a service.”
Reviews.Author: suresh_patel80
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is in a good area, facillity in a room was excellent, staff was very frendly and very helpfull also the pick up and drop off to airport was excellent. Shopping area is not far from the hotel. Will visit again in the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Ren_liverpool_31_61_
Reviews.Content: Great hotel staff can't do enough for you arrived at 9.30 in morning and they had a room ready for us by 10.30, check in wasn't suppose to be till 2.00p.m hotel was really clean and rooms are a very good size. There is a metro station about 15 mins walk away but it is a great service and very cheap. the taxis are also very cheap and take you anywhere, but they drive a bit mad. Done the sand safari which was a great trip really good value for the money. If you can try and buy a book called the Entertainer Family it cost about 350AED about (£50-£70) but it has thousands of vouchers in it for trips and restaurants, we got our money back on the book on the frist trip we booked.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended, friendly staff, great location to get around”
Reviews.Author: JFKtravel
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff. Counter staff knowledge of Dubai is excellent. Our room is cleaned every day. The room on 7th floor was noisy mainly from the building opposite but we asked for a different room and we got a better one on the third floor. Taxi at the front of the hotel were frequent & always available and is cheap. All local telephone calls from the room are free, yellow pages is on hand and we made a few excursions via booking by phone. The surrounding area is very safe and well lit. Very central location to travel to all the sites of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Good value...would stay again”
Reviews.Author: ShaziOK
Reviews.Content: The Winchester is an older hotel so of course the decor is not as modern as some hotels in Dubai but the room was adequate. We had a one bedroom suite luxury, which was ok size. Furniture could do with updating, some stains on the sofas did not make it appealing. In the living room were a 3 and 2 seater sofa, dining table and TV with satelite. There was a kitchen which had a fridge, microwave and washing machine. Tea and coffee stuff was provided along with a kettle. I travelled with my 2 kids 7 & 11. The sofa pulled out to a sofa bed which they both fit on ok. The bedroom was large and had built in waldrobes. The staff were friendly enough and were very responsive if we needed anything in particular like extra towels. There is parking at the back of the hotel and the pool is on the roof, I didnt see the pool but the kids had fun so that was good enough for me. The views out the windows were not great as we were quite close to apartment blocks across but really you dont book a hotel to look out the windows all day! All in all it did what it said on the tin...it was clean, safe and practical for a family of 4. Last note: make sure you are clear on which hotel you are booked into. There is the Winchester Hotel & Apartment and their sister Winchester GRAND Hotel and Apartments. They are not far apart and the staff are happy to direct to very well to the other hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Good Location; Adequate Hotel; Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: Jvalant
Reviews.Content: I was on a short business trip and this hotel was adequate. The only problem was the service. Pros - The rooms were big and clean. Cons - They were supposed to send a car to the airport to pick me up but the car had "problems" so they asked me to cab and they would adjust the cab fare. The free Internet in the room had to be activated and I had to send it at least 7 requests before they finally activated it. The restaurant was shut and the included breakfast in a dingy place in the hotel was a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent pool and a great price”
Reviews.Author: Vakse_Viggo
Reviews.Content: Right between old and new Dubai. Spacious rooms, everything we needed even if it was not newest standard. On top of the building was a great swimming pool. If the price is the same next time we visit Dubai will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel For The Money!”
Reviews.Author: Chris2783
Reviews.Content: I've just got back from a holiday in Dubai, staying at the Winchester Grand, and I was very pleased with my stay there! I had a nice big room with a large double bed, a couple of armchairs and tables, and a nice ensuite with toiletries provided and a bath, not just a shower. Everything was very clean and worked fine - ok, if I wanted to nitpick I'd maybe say the TV was a bit of a disappointment - only 2 English channels, and the picture was a bit fuzzy, but then I don't go on holiday to watch TV. I paid about £50 a night room only, I was on my own and I think even for a solo traveller that was good value, but the room would have been plenty big enough for a couple, and would have been excellent value for two! Everything else at the hotel was good as well. As I mentioned, I stayed on a room only basis, but I ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant every morning anyway, as the breakfast buffet was good - a nice range of hot and cold food, which varied a bit every day - and good value too, only 25AED, which is about £4.50 at the current exchange rate. There's a nice rooftop pool - although the pool and the pool area are both fairly small, so you need to get up there quite early to guarantee yourself a sunlounger! All the staff I encountered were friendly and helpful, and spoke good English. It's in a good location too, close to the city centre, and within walking distance of some nice restaurants and tourist attractions. One other thing worth mentioning - it's a little bit hard to locate! It's in a sidestreet a couple of blocks back from Mankhool Road, the big main road. If you're coming south down Mankhool Road, turn left at the car park just past the Ramada Hotel, go straight on for two blocks, then turn right, and it's on your right, just after another hotel called the Savoy Park. A couple of other tips worth mentioning: There's a big supermarket called Spinneys which is only about 5 minutes walk away on Mankhool Road, and sells pretty much everything food wise you're likely to want - they also sell English newspapers and magazines. Also, if you're desperate for an alcohol fix, the nearest place that serves alcohol is the bar of the Ramada Hotel, also only about 5 minutes walk away on Mankhool Road.

Reviews.Title: “A very basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_Traveller55112
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a basic hotel, this is it! The one advantage about this hotel is that it offers free shuttle to some near-by key sightseeing spots and shopping mall. My husband and I booked this hotel for 2 nights prior to our UAE/Oman cruise which started in Dubai. A construction site was across the street from the hotel. We could hear the noise from the construction till midnight on Sunday night (a working day in UAE).

Reviews.Title: “an excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: thevulch
Reviews.Content: the rooms are a bit well worn but the friendly atmosphere more than compensates for it. the location is excellent. predominatly an indian area but one of the safest location i have ever stayed. pool and roof terrace is a gem. breakfast was geared more to indian but very very enjoyable. much more interesting than normal english.although the typical continental was available. excellent location and would happily stay there again.had washing machine, cooker,microwave large fridge freezer. although only used the fridge. would recomend this hotel but not if looking for a luxury break. wild wadi in my opinion is vastly overpriced for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ganza1307
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my one week holiday with family. The staff were friendly and helpful. Dont expect them to give you customer delight. Lots of equipment in the room needed repairs . I had to call maintenance couple of times. There was a bit of foul smell in the room. The location was perfect. Very close to all attractions. Might try another hotel nearby next time.

Reviews.Title: “ITS GOOD FOR FOR ANYONE ON A BUDGET”
Reviews.Author: G00dH0nestAdvice
Reviews.Content: Hi there. this hotel is good for anyone who wants to stay in a place quite close to the metro with mostly friendly staff. However, this hotel was not a 4 star as advertised! The level of standards was more 2 or 3! The rooms need updating and are a bit dirty. The plates smelt and the bathroom wasnt brilliant. he breakfast was ok, but again, not 4 star!!! The television was not flat screen as advertised, and most of the chanels didnt work, We didnt have a working tv for a few days and it took them a long time to fix it all. I would still advice this place for anyone who wants a good price in a good location but will spend most there time out and about, as this was NO place for luxury which is what i was expecting. it was just OK but very dissapointing for the money we spent.

Reviews.Title: “Fine basic no probs”
Reviews.Author: Felixshortstraw
Reviews.Content: All pretty cheap cheerful but ok - breakfast v basic - staff ok - free wifi in lobby - 10 min walk to Al Karama rail station which will get you most places in Dubai

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sharon1000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location for access to river, airport and central part of Dubai. It is about a 10 min taxi ride from airport to hotel. Taxis in Dubai are cheap so it didn't cost too much to travel to the main centre or airport by taxi. The room was spacious and had a large and very comfortable bed. There was a washing machine in the room which is always appreciated when travelling. It was great to be able to relax on the rooftop pool and use the gym. There was a free shuttle bus which took guests to and from various attractions in Dubai. The hotel staff was very efficient and helpful. We had a problem with our TV and someone was sent up straight away to fix the problem. Construction work going on in the area during the day and night, but is was hardly noticeable as the window is shut and the air conditioner was on. Far too much was charged for the use of the internet in the lobby area. Grout of tiles around bath need to have mould cleaned off them.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable,but beware”
Reviews.Author: Gl0beTr0tter1965
Reviews.Content: We went out to Dubai for the New Year and booked to stay in the Winchester Grand. After arriving about 7.30a.m we were told we could check in immediately if we paid extra for the room, otherwise we could check in at 11.00a.m. This was a bit disappointing having known the room had been vacated and was cleaned ready for our stay. The rooms were spacious with a kitchenette and washing machine that we found very useful. Breakfast was ok, but if you like your full English, no you won't get it! Beware there is building work taking place directly opposite the hotel and they do work 24/7. We had to sleep with cotton wool in our ears to block out the noise. Also beware of the shuttle service they are running. We waited 45 minutes for the shuttle to take us to Al Manza Beach only to find we were dropped at the public beach on Jumeriah. We questioned why we were not taken to the beach park and we were told it was a free service they provided. If we had known this we would have taken a taxi or the metro to the Jumeriah beach residence. They also did a shuttle service to the Burjuman and the museums so just be prepared you may be taken else where. On the whole we had a good holiday and the apartments are centrally located, so it is easy to get around especially when using the metro system. Not sure if i would go back to the Winchester would depend on price when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Two locations with no consistent overbooking / "upgrade" policy”
Reviews.Author: GuillaumeSerail
Reviews.Content: To be honest, we did not make things easy for the hotel management since my brother and I, who share the same first name initial and the same family name, made 2 different bookings, each for his own need. However, Winchester has two hotels in Dubai - quasi same name, different location (quite near). It is impossible on the Website to tell in which one a booking is made. Upon arrival on December 31st 2010, each of the 2locations' Reception Desk held a speech about "upgrading" us to the other hotel. The snake was biting its tail ! Mostly inconvenient moreover is the extremely difficult roadway to reach the location which is inside a streetblock (the other location being easily spotted). Even the map on the hotel's leaflets shows a series of arrows with street names none of which are the same than the reality ('Bank Street' instead of 'Al Mankhool Street')! A Nightmare which ended in my entering the New Year unpacking my luggage at last instead of celebrating with cheering crowds:-(!

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Prabhjot_Minhas
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel and a definite positive that its located quite conveniently...Though certain issues with service but the rooms are comfortable and roomy but a lot of things need to be requested eg-the kettle in the room wasnt working, some fixtures in the bathroom were broken but if i look at it from a perspective that you are out all day and just need a place to crash for the night its a reasonably good hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: doug98
Reviews.Content: Service was very friendly, breakfast was excellent especially with some South Indian options, some electrical faults but they were fixed straight away. Would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good service but some things in the room didn't work”
Reviews.Author: calleg_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for almost a month, in a studio apartment. The room was very good but some things were broken, missing or didn't work. Also, you hear noice through the thin walls... First I had to change room after a few hours because internet didn't work at all on that floor (they should have mentioned this). Second, setting the temperature for the AC didn't work (so it was always cold when it was on). Also, at first the washing machine and the microwave didn't work because the hidden cables were not connected! Some parts in the kitchen were missing too. These last two things they fixed quickly. The service was very good and they were very friendly. I didn't eat breakfast or meals in the restaurant so I can't grade it. I liked the gym and the roof-top pool. The location is good, 5 min to supermarket, 15 mins to shoppingcenter and the metro.

Reviews.Title: “good value basic hotel, good base, noisy/dusty area though”
Reviews.Author: donna11
Reviews.Content: Ok, for the price I paid I am not complaining. It wasn't far from the airport, so it cost 40 dhirams in a cab (which is about £8 english money). There is supposed to be a shuttle or a free shuttle, but there was some confusion over ours and we just got a cab, for the price it was certainly easier than waiting around. Check in was very smoothish... BUT we had booked a studio room. We were told that they had no studio rooms so would be upgraded to a 1 bed (this sounds good right?). However we were told that we might have to leave the 1 bed and go back into a studio if they needed the room later. This was rather annoying as it meant that we were worried about unpacking and filling the fridge, etc in case we were suddenly told to leave the room (which we were not!). I was quite relaxed about all this as I am easygoing but it made my friend tense and he argued with the staff and said it would be unfair if we had to change rooms midway but there was little resolution there. The 1 bed apartment was spacious and we were happy with it. When a fuse blew I called reception and they came and fixed it straight away. My only complaint and it is kind of a biggy is that there are intrusive building works going on all around the hotel and they are very very noisy all day long. This means you can never relax on your balcony (which is a terrible building site view anyway) because the noise is just so loud. If you are going out in the day or staying in your room with the balcony door closed then you will not be too bothered by this. We found the staff REASONABLY friendly. We booked a shuttle for the journey back to the airport. Well not only did we not get one, but we were told we would have to pay for it. In addition the price was slightly more than a taxi would have charged, so you are better off just getting a taxi! Because this hotel is in Bur Dubai it is not near all of the attractions. There is a FREE shuttle bus once a day to the beach (and back) and a FREE shuttle to a few other places (not the airport!). I would not book tours through the hotel as they are more expensive. Get a phone number from the Dubai Map available in reception, there are lots of tour companies listed there. Internet is not included, it is rather expensive. However if you take a walk to Mankhool road, (a rather main road a few minutes away) there are some eating places that have free wifi. As alcohol is difficult to get hold of, they will direct you to the bar at the Ramada hotel. It is horrible and chavy there. You are better of finding a hotel called the Park Regis Hotel which is a 5 minute walk away (very modern). They have a bar in there called the Grandstand Bar and between 6 and 9 there was a 2 for 1 happy hour making the drinks very affordable. Aside from that alcohol in all of Dubai is very expensive and very difficult to get hold of. There is a lovely gym there with many weight/resistance machines and a cycle, 2 treadmills and a rower (no crosstrainer). It is all modern and working equipment. Also a male and female sauna, those facilities were all good. We didn't eat there so I can't comment on the food but it looked reasonably priced (29 dhirams for dinner - that's about £6 english pounds). Lots of supermarkets/restaurants/McDonalds/KFC/Burger King nearby. On the roof there was a pool with sunloungers, it was not a huge space but adequate and pleasant. If I needed to be in this part of Dubai again I'd stay here, but next time I'll stay nearer to Jumeirah beach.

Reviews.Title: “Feel at home”
Reviews.Author: girijamenon
Reviews.Content: I had booked myself to a one bedroom apartment. It was as good as staying home. It had a nice well furnished hall with dining area and a well equipped kitchen including washing machine and a beautiful cozy bedroom. The room service was good so was the maintainable staff. It was in the heart of Bur Dubai and very close to the metro. The food was very good and it had a pool on the roof top. Over all it was worth the money spent and I would highly recommend this to anyone traveling either for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, helpful staff and value for money”
Reviews.Author: ajaysapra
Reviews.Content: I am staying here for 6 months. The Hotel is well located, quite n the staff is very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Building Site Noise”
Reviews.Author: rhsimcock
Reviews.Content: Due to the Building off a new high rise building very noisy from 6am to 10pm every day, the rooms are in need of some attention. It was clean & the swimming pool was out of action. Very disappointed considering previous reports

Reviews.Title: “Nice standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hamza121
Reviews.Content: Is a nice place to stay,good services,the restourant is not bad,nice waiters always keeping an eye incase something misses on the table not least if ur cup of water gets empty, the only thing I was not happy is I lost my digital camera in the room,and what makes me sure is I never took it with me out of the hotel couse I was always using my Iphone out.and when I asked them they tried to ask the room cleaner and he said he never saw it,so I would say to any one staying in the hotel b carefuly of your things in the room.It`s got a nice swimmingpool and gym.

Reviews.Title: “A good business trip”
Reviews.Author: TSO-SY
Reviews.Content: It was a good business trip for me, as I was in Winchester hotel which make my stay very comfortable, the hotel staff were very helpful, professionals and friendly. I will be very glad to stay again inthis hotel. A. Fayez

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Donna186338
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very clean and very accesible in everything.We stayed in studio room and it is spaceous with king size bed which is very comfy.Staff are very helpful and no communication problem occured during our stay.It is a good advantage of their hotel as well that they have a free shuttle service going to those major places.The only downfall is the WIFI which cost me a fortune.

HotelInfo.Name: Winchester Grand Hotel Apartments
HotelInfo.Address: 10B Street, Al Mankhool, Dubai 29016, United Arab Emirates
